titlestmt.subtitle: Finding Aid
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Elisha Winkler.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in NoteTab Pro. Encoded by Deborah A. Richards. 2006-03-31

did.head: Collection Overview

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Smith College. Dept. of Computer Science.

did.abstract: This collection is in three folders and contains exam questions, newspaper articles, and black and white photographs.

bioghist.p: Computer science was first taught for credit at Smith College in 1972 by Bert Mendelson, who was the founder of the program. The Department of Computer Science was established in 1988 by college president Mary Maples Dunn.

scopecontent.p: The Computer Science Department records, 1979-85 and 1993, contain materials describing the courses, students, and faculty of the department. Types of materials include a final exam, newspaper articles, and black and white photographs of students and faculty.

userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the documents must be requested from the Smith College Archives. Smith College owns copyright to any published material relating to college events and activities. Provenance and copyright ownership of other materials is unknown and researchers are responsible for determining any question of copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Smith College Dept. of Computer Science Records, Box #, Smith College Archives.

acqinfo.p: The Computer Science Department records were created by the department and tranferred to the College Archives.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Researchers should also view: RG 42. Faculty

did.unittitle: Newspaper articles, black and white photos 1979, 1980-85, 1988
